Posts.Content: Hey Wendy, having a low blood count is just your body not healing between treatments....not much you can do either, but try not to worry, the chemo nurses will keep a check on you, i had that couple times during my chemo, its annoying delaying treatments but your body needs to do its stuff..... Take care Keep strong Treena xxxx
Posts.Title: Chemo - Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: hi looby, sorry to hear your news, i was diagnosed  one week before my 40th birthday this summer....the thing that got me through i was fighting it to see my daughter grow up....its difficult, its emotional, all you can do is talk, be honest how you feel to everyone, had lumpectomy which went well, it was scary but with plenty of cuddles from family and friends it does make you stronger and you will be suprised how much you can achieve...........iv recently started my chemo, got a long way to go but i have a very got support team of family and friends behind me, constanatly calling, texting, emailing, also iv found doing or watching something funny helps..........sounds weird but its fab :) take care babe keep in touch, keep chatting on here we understand xx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - very scared and emotional

Posts.Content: Hey Monet, I had arm pain during my sessions of chemo, but only during the sessions i forgot to ask for heat pad....trust me it helped...the heat opens up the veins more...apparently!! all i know is the pad took the pain away....maybe ask for heat pad next time see if it helps??  You Do Not have to put up with pain..... having chemo is enough without added extras......let me know if it helps xx
Posts.Title: Arm pain ?

Posts.Content: Hey Mishka......you are not alone and definately not going mad........ take each day as it comes, slowly does it, it will and definately does get better...... I felt the same way when i had my op, do your exercises and take it slowly........let me no how you are Take care sending Big Hugs Treena xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Just had my op..ouch

Posts.Content: Hiya, just read your post,first off congratulations in completion of treatments.... i have the same thing with inlaws, although iv just finished chemo just starting radio......all through my treatments and op before that they always blanked it out, my father in law says because i look fine i am fine....its amazing how much make up and a smile can hide, iv heard from different people that it takes a good year or so for your body to get back to some normality, so listen to your body only you know how your feeling, if you want to have a rest, have a rest, until someone goes through all this they dont know how hard it is. Dont beat yourself up.....be honest with your family, that way they can support you more, Take care let me know how you get on Treena xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Is this normal ?
